symptoms.name: Lower limb weakness
symptoms.severity: Variable, from mild weakness to paralysis
symptoms.pattern: Acute onset, progressive in some cases

symptoms.name: Sensory impairment
symptoms.severity: Variable, can affect pain, temperature, touch, vibration, and proprioception
symptoms.pattern: Often below a specific dermatome level

symptoms.name: Bladder dysfunction
symptoms.severity: Variable, from urinary retention to incontinence

symptoms.name: Fever
symptoms.pattern: May precede or accompany neurological symptoms

symptoms.name: Generalized vesicular eruptions
symptoms.pattern: May precede, accompany, or be absent in some cases

symptoms.name: Throbbing pain
symptoms.pattern: May be localized to a specific area

symptoms.name: Numbness
symptoms.pattern: May be localized to a specific area

vital_signs.heart_rate: Can be normal or slightly elevated

physical_findings: Decreased strength in lower limbs (variable grades)
Decreased sensation in lower limbs (variable modalities and levels)

imaging_findings.mri_spine: Diffuse hyperintensity in spinal cord on T2-weighted images, often at a specific level (e.g., T4-T11, C6-C7)
imaging_findings.mri_brain: Increased signal intensity in certain lobes (e.g., right temporo-occipital lobe, left frontal lobe) suggesting encephalitis

required: Clinical presentation consistent with myelitis (e.g., weakness, sensory loss, bladder/bowel dysfunction)
Evidence of VZV infection (e.g., positive serology, PCR detection of VZV DNA in CSF)
supportive: Elevated protein and white blood cell count in CSF

differential_diagnoses: Transverse myelitis due to other causes (e.g., autoimmune diseases, infections with other viruses)
Compressive lesions of the spinal cord
